Negative Reviews: The terrace/pool area was very tired looking and not very clean
Positive Reviews: good size family room. the hostel had a lovely relaxed and comfortable vibe. The breakfast was fantastic.

Negative Reviews:
They did not keep up with cleaning the little shower room. It was rusty and moldy.
There is no sink in the toilet so be aware of that if you need it.
Positive Reviews: We had been here five years ago and absolutly loved it, came back and were happy to do so. The beds are comfortable and give enough privacy with the curtains. There are walking tours and dinner every day so it is easy to get to know some people if you are travelling alone and there is something to do, even if you were to lazy to think about it yourself 😅

Review Title: Very nice and clean place to stay. The staff is attentive and cool.
Negative Reviews: In the shower stall a little bit of separation on the floor between the shower and the "dry" area would be good to put on clothes without getting them wet.
Positive Reviews: The lockers were big enough to put the whole suitcase inside and then some. This kept the room looking tidy and your personal belongings safe. The dinners and breakfasts were a good value and tasted good.

Negative Reviews: Maybe only the ventilation of the rooms at night.
Positive Reviews: Good food, rooms, rooftop and pub crawl.

Negative Reviews: Small shower room and week water power
Positive Reviews: Breakfast, Rooftop, Clean and cozy bed

Negative Reviews: I understand this is hard to control but my roommates were eating in the room and they left the packages of ice cream and pizza boxes there overnight. There is even some sausage on the floor. It will be appreciated if there is a few ground rules for eating in the bedroom...
Positive Reviews: The dinner was great (need to pay), the atmosphere was good, and it was a great chance to meet new people! The bed is thick and comfortable.

Negative Reviews:
I didn't like the airco. For me it was too cold. I had to wear a hoodie in the gaming /lounge room, because I was getting too cold.

The breakfast was okay, but not too much choice. It starts officially at 8,  but bread, fresh pastries and fresh eggs would come around 8:30 . No veggies at all. 

And of course I knew it was a hostel when I was booking it, but what I didn't take into account is that Barcelona is a very young/party/night life city full of young tourists. So all my dorm was going or coming back from partying loudly during the night. Or start packing the bags at 3am ( because that's when you do it). Anyway, I stayed for 7 nights and my sleep was awful. So if you're coming to Barcelona for work, think twice to book your stay in the hostel (any hostel in that case).
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, price, parking. Parking was narrow, but really doable. And the staff is very friendly and helpful .

Review Title: Good hostel but not the best if you want to relax
Negative Reviews: Even though hostel was nice my experience wasn’t the best. First of all because of the people there and their mentality hostel is almost like a frat house. Walls are very thin so you can hear everything from other rooms. And oh boy not only they talk loudly they scream all the time with random music even in the middle of night. And since the hostel is in nice location people are into party stuff. So they can bust into room at 5AM vomiting, shouting and doing other drunk irresponsible behaviors. In short if you want a relaxing experience and good sleep after exhausting day this is not the place.
Positive Reviews: The hostel has good facilities, almost everything you’d look for a hostel. Bed is comfortable, curtain is a nice addition, two storage which are big enough and nice location.

Review Title: Great place for solo travellers to stay and hang out
Negative Reviews: Checkin is from 15:00, could have been a bit earlier for me. On the other hand I was able to drop off my baggage already before that time for free so all good, nothing else i disliked
Positive Reviews: I loved the common spaces in this hostel, probably one of the nicest I've ever been. We were hanging out at the rooftop pool a lot, met great people there. It isn't too big so you always get a chance to socialize. Also the lounge is cozy and nice, great for chilling or reading. My bed was very comfy, had a curtain which i appreciated as some guests came late night (cause of a delayed flight) so i had my pyjama privacy. Breakfast was really tasty too - there was an option to make your own fresh pancakes! Yum.

Review Title: 11/10 absolutely perfect! Clean, great location, fun social events!
Positive Reviews: This hostel is just perfect, not a single complaint! The rooms are spacious and cleaned every day. The beds are comfortable and have privacy curtains, outlets and lights. It is a very social hostel with daily activities that are hosted by super fun people and are a great way to meet other travelers! Everyone is very respectful and not too loud at night The pool on the roof top is an added bonus to chill out and have some drinks.

Negative Reviews: No complaints.
Positive Reviews: Bedrooms are spacious, everything was very clean and looking like new. The activities are very interesting like the pub crawl and they offer breakfast and dinner for a very good price. Breakfast is very good.

Review Title: probably the best hostel both for fun and good sleep
Negative Reviews: na
Positive Reviews: facilities were great , very clean and great breakfast

Negative Reviews: It’s not very close to the Gothic Quarter but not too far.
Positive Reviews: Spacious room, comfy bed with curtain, big locker under the bed, good breakfast and dinner provided at a reasonable price, close to a metro station.

Walking tour is amazing, shared dinners are a great way to meet other travellers. All the facilities are great, the common room, laundry, rooftop bar; one of the best hostels I’ve stayed at 😊
Also felt really safe knowing the reception is on 24/7 and only allows guests in with wrist band
Nothing to complain tbh, it was super clean, comfortable and well organised. The breakfast was really good for the price :) Wifi was working great too.

Negative Reviews: Nothing.
Positive Reviews:
I really liked that the bedroom has enough space, the locker is huge, there are lots of hangers, a table and benches, even a balcony, the sink is outside the bathroom and the toilet is apart from the shower. Also, there's air-conditioning. It was summertime when I went there.
Breakfast is really good and the walking tour with Mario was memorable. Loved it!
The room is very clean, bed comfortable, lots of space to storage bags bellow the bed. Really good breakfast and dinner!

Really nice and welcoming hostel near the Sagrada Familia, Casa Milà and Casa Battló and Verdaguer metro station. Comfortable beds with curtains,a light and power socket + USB outlets and a spaceous locker under bed. I was warmly welcomed and received all the info concerning breakfast, dinner, walking tour, ... . Would really recommend!

Spotless clean great facilities and they have daily walking tours, group dinners each night followed by pub crawls which is a good option to have for solo travelers. The decor is nice and modern and there is a nice rooftop terrace.

Fantastic, the best hostel! The breakfast is very good, bar is also good (everyone must try sangria), and the bed is cozy, I slept really well. I would definitely recommend and go back when I visit Barcelona again.

Fantastic, the best hostel! The breakfast is very good, bar is also good (everyone must try sangria), and the bed is cozy, I slept really well. I would definitely recommend and go back when I visit Barcelona again.

One of the best hostels that I visited!
Very comfortable beds, each room has a bathroom. 
Very nice and well equipped common spaces - kitchen, living room and dining room. They offer a breakfast and dinner everyday with delicious food and after that you can also join the party/pub crawl.
If I come back to Barcelona I will for sure choose this place to stay :)

Negative Reviews: No complaints.
Positive Reviews: Bedrooms are spacious, everything was very clean and looking like new. The activities are very interesting like the pub crawl and they offer breakfast and dinner for a very good price. Breakfast is very good.

Review Title: Great for a couple of days
Positive Reviews: Great place, clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast is really good and fresh.

Review Title: Great, clean hostel with friendly and helpful staff
Negative Reviews: Location was a walk from most of the main attractions in Barcelona, and in a quieter area. It was a nice area but it wasn’t the most perfect location for a solo female traveller to be walking back alone at night. The top bunks also didn’t have curtains, only the bottom bunks. They were high up so privacy wasn’t too much of an issue, but it would have been nice to have a curtain.
Positive Reviews: Great hostel! Comfortable, clean, staff were really friendly and helpful. The common areas in the hostel were especially nice and well-equipped.

Review Title: It’s budget friendly, but don’t expect support from reception too much if something happens.
Negative Reviews:
There was only 1 elevator, so I needed to wait for many minutes while the elevator went up and down to pick up other guests that pressed the button first. A lot of guest I talked shared the same frustration.

The closet that’s built in to the bed for dorm room doesn’t have any lock. I ended up buying one from reception m, which was 3 euro. I wish they told me about this beforehand so I can just bring my own. What’s the point of the “personal locker” if it doesn’t have a lock… smh 

There was a gap between my bed and the wall that was infuriating. I dropped my iPhone 2 time and it was very difficult to retrieve it. I asked the staff each time I dropped it, but first one didn’t help me, second one just gave me a pole that didn’t even fit the gap.
The person sleeping above me also dropped her phone while I was sleeping — it hit my head. That was VERY UNPLEASANT.
Positive Reviews:
New and clean facility. 

The system is easy and convenient. 

The location is perfect — walking distance from La Sagrada Familia, as well as to Gothic sector, but not too close. 

I didn’t join but the tour they offer was well received by many guests that I talked with.

Negative Reviews:
Just a couple small things:
1) a member of the staff came to open and close the window every day, and since they closed it in the afternoon it could get a little bit stuffy in the room. I guess it's safety regulations but it would have been great if we could open the window ourselves.
2) there's only one elevator for 6+ floors so it made a lot of unnecessary trips, you could in the elevator to go down and end up going up first...
Positive Reviews: Great breakfast with lots of choices for only €7, and a really nice dinner for €12. Good atmosphere in the hostel, with plenty of spots to hang out and a cool roof. Lots of space for your stuff in the bedroom - huge lockers, lots of hooks etc'. I enjoyed my stay!

Negative Reviews: It was really warm in the rooms and the windows were not allowed to open in the evening/night so it got really warm at night.
Positive Reviews: It was super clean and everything looked really new and well maintained. Also the beds were really comfortable and it was a big plus that each room had own bathroom facilities. The pub crawl and diner is something you should consider!

Negative Reviews: Better lighting in the room maybe?
Positive Reviews: This is such a great hostel in Barcelona! The rooms are super spacious, and the storage space is really good. Shower is nice and big, and all the extra facilities are awesome - especially the rooftop area! Super clean and tidy.

Negative Reviews: Not much to complain about. Bed was creeky, which is awkward when sleeping in a room with others. That's pretty much the only thing :)
Positive Reviews: Yeah hostel is amazing for solo travellers and groups. There is such a vibe at the hostel, pretty much always. A bar to chill at and plenty of social events to meet people. Highly recommend staying here it's awesome!

There was some fruit, cereals, 1 option of ham, 1 option of cheese (which later ended). The next morning I had breakfast at the beach location, not in a hostel.
Positive Reviews: The view from the room was great (I stayed on the 6th floor), bed very, very confy, Wifi works perfect. On the top floor (7th) there is a bar and a swimming pool where you can talk and relax. There is a metro station really close by; shops where you can buy food or other things. The Sagrada Familia is within walking distance. Everything else is easily accessible by metro. Remember to bring your own lock to keep your belongings safe in the room. Overall, my stay went smoothly.

Positive Reviews: this was the best experience in hostel I could ever seen. hostel has very good location. what is the best , hostel has good disposition inside , space is perfectly selected for night part zone and day part zone. also bathroom is separated from these two zones, so when a person comes to bed at night (after party) for example, there is no stupid noise in the room coming from using sink or shower, and other people can have sweet sleep. beds are located just next to tha wall and they  have curtains, so you have always little own privacy, and you are protected against light at night, when somebody comes to bed late..I appreciate the day zone, it looks like at your own home, kitchen joined with living room, people are together, talking to each other although they are foreingners .  there was always a person in hostel who was tiding kitchen and bathroom for whole the time, speaking to each other, giving reccomendatoins about trips in Mallorca.

Positive Reviews: Really appreciate how the hostel staff created a sense of community through the themed dinners, daily walking tours, and pub crawls — made us feel very welcome. The neighborhood it was in was in was also very accessible and walkable to plenty of key sites we wanted to see. Breakfast was great, as well — with great value for money (as with all the activities) 👌🏽
The staff were so lovely and helpful! The breakfast buffet was amazing value and really tasty!
The common areas were nice. Staff was very kind and the dinners were fun and tasty.
Dinners, party organizing, nice staff.

Review Title: we had a double room and it was the best option ever as we had our privacy and the perks for the hostel at the same time
Positive Reviews: friendly staff, rooftop terrace, organized dinner and night tour!!

Negative Reviews: Didn’t get into the night club on crawl
Positive Reviews: Staff very friendly, good breakfast, tour with Mario was great

Very good Hostel, highly recommend!! Staff is very helpful, pleasant and they offer things like a free walking tour in town and pub crawl for example. Tried both and the experiences I made were very good 👍 😀 Furthermore the food was suberb!! For 7 € you get a really delicious breakfast with lots of variety and the dinner costs about 12 € for a three course meal and is also very good!! Last but not least it's easy to connect with other people from all over the world and thus also perfect for single travellers 😊😊

Review Title: Worth every penny, great place to stay! Even if you’re an oldie like me

Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews: Very clean, very nice staff, cool place.

Negative Reviews: The top bunks are a bit hard to get in and out of! They need a handle or two. It's also a bit hard to use the kitchen on the evening, as the cooks are in there prepping the "family dinner".
Positive Reviews: Really comfy beds, lots of amenities and services. I had a really nice stay. This is a top-notch city hostel.

Review Title: Living La Vida Loca at Yeah Hostel
Negative Reviews: The elevator can get a bit crowded in the morning. The stairs are an alternative option. The ventilation is my room was not very good, especially when many people are all taking a shower. Maybe the hostel is worried about people smoking in the rooms.
Positive Reviews: This is one of the cleanest hostels I've ever stayed at. The morning tour is a good way to meet people. 10 minutes away from La Sagrada Familia. I met some awesome people at this hostel, one in particular. The drinks and dinner are fairly priced. The breakfast is only €7 and will fill you up. I appreciated the security controls and cameras throughout the hostel.

Review Title: Awesome stay and perfect for what we needed

Positive Reviews:
Loved the activities, the hostel dinner and walking tour were great. The facilities were nice too, kitchen, dining/bar and chill area were all very comfortable to use. 
Really big under bed draws for luggage and smaller lockers at the head of each bed was great.

Negative Reviews: Climbing up and down the upper bunk bed was challenging to me who has osteoarthritis. The staff tried to get me a lower bunk bed but their attempts proved futile.
Positive Reviews: The location, and the friendly staff.

The location is close to one of the best shopping streets of Barcelona and the metro station.

Negative Reviews: Some things can be improved, but overall is fine. Just be patient for the elevator. The Argentinian guy at the reception is very helpful and nice.

Positive Reviews: The bed, Wi-F iis okay, the opcional tour (program for the guests) location is good but not too much.

Negative Reviews: Slightly limited options at breakfast, alarms constantly going off in the room for unknown reasons
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, beds were comfortable

Negative Reviews: It was always annoying that the roof closed at 9, as it was such a nice place and when dinner was not something desirable, it would be nice to stay up there with friends. It would be nice to have a bathroom on the roof as well.
Positive Reviews: Honestly, almost everything was an example of what the perfect hostel should be. I'm not going to list them. Best things were that every day there were walking tours and breakfast/dinner to get people together. Also, the beds had everything a perfect hostel bed (and dorm room in general) should have.

Negative Reviews: There was a kitchen but the hostel has an option of joining them for dinner. So there is always a chef cooking in there. It was hard to navigate and cook around them. Its a huge hostel, even though I met cool people, I felt that it was less intimate than the others since people came ad left all the time.
Positive Reviews: Location was great, in a quiet area, but close to the metro and a few attractions. The staff was friendly and made guests feel welcomed. There was a lovely lounge to chill in upstairs and a great rooftop as well.

Negative Reviews:
The hostel, in particular the social activities, is geared towards a younger party-seeking crowd and I didn’t find it to be a very culturally immersive experience. Everything is in English and the staff responded in English when I tried to converse in Spanish. Some of the staff were a little rude and condescending when I asked for dining recommendations in the area.

The communal dinner was acceptable but not comparable in quality to what you would get by going out to a restaurant or bar. I heard from other guests that the paella is excellent, though.

I was on a top bunk which is significantly less comfortable and convenient, the rooms were hot at night and the heat rose. There is no privacy curtain for the top bunks. There is too much of a difference in value between top and bottom and the price needs to reflect this or the top bunks need to be made more comfortable.

There is only one washer and dryer and they seemed to be occupied at all times. When they were finally available, the washer left a disgusting smell in my clothes and the dryer didn’t completely dry everything after an hour and a half, and I had to hang things up in the room to dry.
Positive Reviews: The facilities were clean, and I appreciated the opportunities for social activities. The lounge is very nice if you arrive early before check in. The hostel is in a good location, walkable to most things and close to the metro. Terrace with pool is great, especially when the bar is open.

Negative Reviews:
No one took COVID or any safety measures seriously, most staff and hostel guests especially rarely ever wore masks. Don't know if it's me, but the cheery dramatic attitude of the receptionists really got on my nerves when I asked for just simple favors, as little as asking for a towel or wanting to order breakfast. I was bombarded with a dramatic scene and questions about my origin instead of simply being handed a towel. My friend's bed was in questionable condition as there were food crumbs and piles of dust within the bed frame and even found a used COVID mask next to her pillow.
I brought a shopping bag from my home country and put it next to another paper bag I got from shopping at el corte inglés, the next day the cleaning staff arrived, all my bags were gone. To my knowledge they didn't contain anything valuable in them but on their own at least the first bag was valuable to me. All gone and no one's seen anything when I asked.
Windows cannot be opened overnight "according to the Spanish law" it says in red on the glass. Never heard of that law in my life, not even from a local but this lead to terrible air ventilation at night time which is a problem in times of COVID and living with strangers in a 6-bed room.
Oh and the room had poor lighting. I see the point of not waking up your fellow room mates by flashy lights but overall it was quite dark.
Positive Reviews: Kitchen, Lounge, and dining room open at almost all hours. Good location, near access to public transport. Giant place to meet people from somewhere else.

Review Title: Great first time in a hostel!
Negative Reviews: My only issue was that there was no trash can inside the room and the small one in the bathroom wasn't emptied daily. It didn't cause any issue but would be a great touch.
Positive Reviews: The bed linens were clean and smelt fresh.  The storage drawers were very big and allowed me to store away my things with ease. The privacy curtain were thick and allowed me to sleep peacefully at night.

Positive Reviews: This is what you call a "professional" hostel. Everything was highy quality and clean. Bathroom, toilet and sink are all separated in the room. It might seem a bit expansive compared to other hostels, but it is definitely worth it.

Positive Reviews: clean and modern

Review Title: A friendly and sociable hostel in a good location for Barcelona
Negative Reviews:
/ Shower room was a little humid with black mould spores on the ceiling.
/ Sink tap was stuck on cold so it wasn't possible to wash hands or shave with warm water.
Positive Reviews:
/ Evening meal for €12 was great value, tasty and a great way to meet new people. Recommended for your first night!
/ Walking tour was interesting, cheap (tips only) and included some good recommendations.
/ Full width privacy curtains on lower bunk beds mean you have privacy and can make it dark whenever you want a siesta!
/ Only 4 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station.
/ Some nice areas to chill out including an egg chair, sofas, large bed, desks etc.
/ Free luggage storage.

Negative Reviews:
I had an earache the night I arrived, I called my insurance and they offered to send a doctor. I asked in reception if the doctor could come and the guy working at that moment checked if there was a free room so I could use it, and there was not, so he told me that the doctor could not go because guests were gonna think there was a covid case in the hostel. 
I understood and went to the doctor myself, end up coming back at 12 with a bad earache. There are other health issues apart from covid for next time.
Positive Reviews: The bed was a 10 out of 10. There is a common area with a big table. This was perfect for me because I was working during the day. Wi-Fi worked excellently. They offer meals at night which is perfect to meet people if you are a solo traveler.

Review Title: so noisy make I can’t sleep well

the public area is good and relax
clean

when someone has taken a shower, the whole room is stuffy and humid, the balcony is always locked and the room is with poor ventilation , so the upper bed will be particularly uncomfortable.
also the soundproofing is not good.

Positive Reviews: The bed was so comfortable, and all things was clean and good

Review Title: Like a okay stay, especially given the price. But doesn't meet my expectation given its high rating.
Negative Reviews:
Well the room key wasn't able to open the gate. The sign says "show your key and we will open the door for you." But the problem was, the front desk staff wasn't always there as they are supposed to be. So when I came back to the hosel, I was locked outside, kept pressing the doorbell button but no one answered, waited outside the door for quite a bit until someone finally came. It was a tired and scary experience (thank god my friends walked me back and waited with me).

Also there was no common bathroom at each floor and the sink in the room wasn't in the bathroom compartment. So when I came back late, I tried very hard to brush my teeth quietly and briefly to not wake up anyone. The door alarm also ringed in the morning for no reason? Like maybe something wasn't locked properly but nobody understood why so it just kept going off. (not sure about this part because I was annoyed for a well but didn't get up and check).
Positive Reviews: Bed was ok. In general clean. Common space pretty big and nice with comfortable couches. I love hostels with bed curtains.

Review Title: There might be better and welcoming hostels nearby
Negative Reviews: they gave us key to wrong room while checking in and we went out and came late to find out people sleeping in our bed , our luggage kept on side. the staff could have just shifted it to our designated room to make up for their mistake. on top of it they did not even mention it. Also they charge for towels.
Positive Reviews: Location was good. The beds were comfortable too.
Nice people nice room more space I’d expected so nice. The bathroom was also clean and barrier free.

Negative Reviews: Nothing!
Positive Reviews:
We had a private room - I really enjoyed the blackout curtains on the bottom bunks, the little lockers and charging spaces at the head of the bed and individual lights! The toilet and shower being separate was ace.

We took the Gothic Quarter walking tour with Pablo which was a highlight of the trip!
It was already my second stay and it‘s a really cool hostel, nice, modern and clean facilities. Also social vibes. Gracia is a great place to stay in Barcelona!

Negative Reviews: Can the steps up to the top bunk be made wider or with some padding? Climbing up them always hurt my feet.
Positive Reviews:
The hostel rooms are well designed with a bathroom in each dorm. It was a little cosy in terms of space in the room but that’s always the case in big cities!

The drawers for your bag were great, heaps of hooks in the bathroom and a storage cupboard for each bed.
Fantastic vibe, probably our best hostel of our Europe trip. We had a 6 bed dorm for our group. The design was clever and had enough space for all our personal belongings. Highly recommend!

Review Title: Safe hostel for a good price
Negative Reviews: The place is a few km away from the city centre, so be prepared with walking shoes or a metro card. The rooms are kind of small and the bed is comfy, but hard. Since you really can hear the noise from the other rooms, i also recommend bringing earplugs (and sleeping eyemask) for the nighttime. The bathroom, the sink and the shower are separated (sink in the room, next to beds) which was not too convenient in the morning and night. Lastly, the elevator was very slow so make sure to take the stairs or just be patient hahah :D Even though these things bothered me a little bit, I think for the price it’s a great hostel and overall I’m satisfied! These are just things I’d like to point out before booking.
Positive Reviews: Overall a good place to meet very nice people! The area felt safe anytime during the day/night and the hostel had a lot of safety measures. The terrace was also great, and the ac in the room was supereffective. Breakfast was 5€ and that was totally worth it. However there are some things to have in mind when booking.

Review Title: Wouldn’t stay again - hot water in a room is a necessity.
Negative Reviews: The sink in the room does not have warm water. The lock couldn’t fit the under-bed compartment because it doesn’t close. The room was overheated and you couldn’t adjust it. The staff blatantly compared my nationality to ‘slavic or russian’. A lot of extra fees though booking said ‘all fees included’, including for a towel.

it was an amazing stay. the hostel organizes many wonderful activities to make the stay more interesting.
I met many good people there and made new friends. it was my first time staying in hostel rather than hotel or Airbnb. I was traveling along so I needed some people to explore the city with and I found them staying in Yeah Barcelona hostel.
the night parties are my favorites. if you like partying I promise you gonna like the parties in Barcelona. Also, every morning the hostel organizes free city tours to learn more about Barcelona its architecture and history.
furthermore, you can have breakfast for only 7 eur and dinner for 12eur. trust me eating out you will spend so much more.

Negative Reviews: Didn't get well with the man at the reception, but the rest of the staff was really kind. Breakfast is 5€ but probably it's not worth the price (you can eat and drink as much as you want, but the quality is not the best). AC could be a problem because you can't control the temperature and in fact on my first night I woke up  very early in the morning freezing with the AC turned on at like 18° (probably they know this could be a problem, because we were provided with blankets even if it was september and the weathe was still quite hot outside.
Positive Reviews: Good hostel with nice people and a great common area on the 1st floor where you can enjoy the evening with other people. On my second day there was a "paella-night". In the kitchen there's a fridge where you can store food and drinks. The 4-beds dorm is big (and with very big lockers where you can store even up to 2 big backpacks), the bedroom and the toilet were very well cleaned. Comfortable beds and modern rooms.

Negative Reviews: Staffs need to prepare breakfast & dinner. If you would like to prepare your own meal, the kitchen's space & sink is not sufficient.
Positive Reviews: Easy to reach the property / Clean / Property has offered breakfast or dinner - value for money

Negative Reviews:
Unfortunately, it was rather difficult to use the kitchen, as the chef making the dinners would occupy the kitchen from 5-9, I almost felt like I was intruding by wanting to cook my own food.

The showers were not ideal, very small space, no proper ventilation.

I found staff to be quite rude, abrupt and I’m quite sure, the manager was a homophobe, so I won’t be staying at this hostel again.
Positive Reviews: The chill out areas were quite good, the kitchen was large and fully stocked, the rooftop was a great added bonus and the bed was comfortable.

Negative Reviews:
They offer a free shared kitchen as the all normal hostels do where you can cook your own food. Here is the trick - it's not only for the guests, their staff also work there throughout the day starting from 8a.m. preparing breakfasts and dinners for which you have to pay. Guests and staff being together in the kitchen at the same time creates a mess, which means if you dared to try you'll simply be unable to get your meals prepared. So their message is either you pay for a breakfast and dinner to them or having it anywhere else or simply starving. A friendly and social home-like environment which is crucial for hostels simply doesn't exist here. All they do is making money out of you in the most blunt and straightforward manner. 
Utterly rudiciolus rules of order such as ban on eating or drinking in the room, inviting guests from other rooms and opening the windows during the night makes that place military camp/prison style looking. In one morning I tried to take a teabag to make a cup of tea, but then suddenly dude from the reception rushed to me and ticked me off for doing so. What's wrong with them? I paid €60 per night for bed in 4 beds room and can't even take a teabag
Positive Reviews: Comfy beds and overall cleaness

Review Title: Forget everything you know about hostels before coming here

Review Title: You might not get a good nights sleep, espacially if you sleep in the upper bed
Negative Reviews:
Upper bed: Had no curtain and open spaces between all the people in the top, so you can hear snoring loud and clear, amplified by the short space up to the roof. No easy way to hold on to the bed while climbing up/down the ladder. Also has gaps on all three or four sides where things can fall down (I was restless, because there was a drunk guy in my room and my airpods fell down to the guy below..)

Lower: You get curtains and some privacy. I had to change rooms the last day, since they did something wrong.

I didn't get any information the day before, and had a hiking tour in the morning. When I came back exhausted(since I didn't get any sleep). The ataff rushed me to clean and move my room, and i finally got the keys to the new onr. I was starving, but sid what they asked for. They had gathered all my stuff in the reception, and I told them I'm hungrt and exhausted ao I wanted to grab something from the store across the street. There was a staff member with a colorful hat, that looked older then the rest, I think his name was Raul. He told me I had to take the bag up to my room..  I was furious and took the bag to the store and came back with it. This is so disrespectdul, since their mistakes are the only reason I had to change rooms in the first place. The rrst of the staff was supernice!

1. The hot water in the washbasin is broken and cannot release hot water. You can only wash in the shower every day, which is very inconvenient

- At least 1.5 km walk to center

- Common area is very limited and the terrace was close at 9:00 pm.

Review Title: Good hostel, but they're starting to think providing a fridge is a favor instead of a selling point
Negative Reviews: Used to be a good hostel, but they're becoming complacent and starting to make arbitrary decisions, like restricted access to the fridge. Unlike before access to the fridge was unrestricted, I tried to give them a feedback that that’s what makes the difference between having a 9+ rating, or me commuting 15mins to theirs instead of booking other hostels downtown, instead of listening to the feedback they got into debate and made it sound like providing a fridge was a favor, you know there's a management problem when a business starts to think their selling point is a favor.
Garage - most narrow garage I've ever seen. It should be free of charge for guests who dare to use it.

They illegally obtained a very private and sensitive information related to an incident I had in another hostel.
They banned me from suing their hostel , despite me being a long time , respectful and loyal customer , based on unsubstantiated information they retrieved illegally about an incident that is still under an investigation by ANOTHER hostel and has NOTHING to do with YEAH hostel not has any affect on it.
Absolutely disgusting and even probably illegal behavior.
Will consider my next steps if you don't remove the ban and apologize for your wrong behavior.
